Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2014 11:15AM NicNak wrote: Hello there! I had my BMX last April by Dr. Davis. I wasn't too crazy about his bedside manner at first, but he is very knowledgeable and I have to say, he did a great job on my surgery. He was able to get clear margins and my scars healed great. I really liked Janet, his office manager. She always returned my calls and walked me through all of the insurance and authorization procedures. I am now moving on to reconstruction after radiation and chemo. I know there is not a lot of info for Vegas doctors on here, so if you have any questions, please PM me! :)
Posts.Title: General Surgeons - Las Vegas, NV? Stareyed Stareyed

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2016 11:23AM NicNak wrote: Started Stage 3 in 2012. Spread to hip, spine, and lung April this year and to brain in November, so I am securely in this group now.
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? zarovka SimonH

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2016 04:40PM NicNak wrote: Back at is again. I was in remission for 2.5 years and now have bone mets. Starting on taxotere today. REALLY nervous about this one. I know it is harsh. I have a 5 month old baby at home that I care for all day (stay at home mom). I am versus that I won't be able to take care of her and manage side effects. Are they any girls out there that have done taxotere ans didn't physically fall apart?????
Posts.Title: April 2015 Chemo Crew... Starting in April? Please join us! KBeee KBeee

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2016 05:52AM NicNak wrote: Thank you so much for posting this. You have no idea how much I needed to read this today. My kids are 11, 8, and 1. I got stage 4 diagnosis this year and all I can think about is that I may not be able to see my baby girl grow up. I cry myself to sleep many nights worrying about that and I come to the boards hoping to find stories like yours. They give me hope. May God bless you with many many more years!! Please keep checking back with us!
